Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness and procedural fairness of PRRA officer's decision
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa, had criminal record, claimed threats in home country (Dominican Republic)
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant with expired visa and criminal history
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Overstayed visa and failed to provide sufficient evidence of risk
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of torture or cruel treatment upon return to Dominican Republic
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard for administrative decisions under IRPA
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant's claims and supporting evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged lack of procedural fairness in PRRA assessment
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness, unless procedural fairness is at issue (correctness applies)
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's claims found not credible; insufficient personal evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Personal affidavit, letter from mother, criminal record, immigration history
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections of IRPA related to Pre-Removal Risk Assessment (PRRA)
Crimes.Application_Basis: Fear of persecution/torture upon removal to the Dominican Republic
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Letter from applicant’s mother deemed unreliable; no corroborating evidence provided
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal and acceptance of PRRA claim based on risk
Crimes.Governing_Rule: PRRA officers assess individual risk of torture, cruel treatment, or death under IRPA
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence to establish a credible risk of harm
Crimes.Outcome: PRRA decision upheld; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No credible risk of torture or cruel treatment found
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant's PRRA application was rejected due to insufficient evidence of risk upon return
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer assessed available evidence and found it inadequate to support claim
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions regarding admissibility and removal
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of reliable, independent corroboration of claimed threats
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failed to maintain legal status due to visa overstay
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Negative credibility finding due to gaps in evidence and delays in seeking protection
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No objective basis to conclude applicant would face torture or cruel treatment
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) – PRRA Officer
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Unreliable third-party letter and lack of official documentation
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Standard of reasonableness applied to PRRA decision

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether PRRA officer erred in assessing evidence and credibility
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and Regulations
Crimes.Decision_Level: Administrative (PRRA Officer), reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant’s evidence lacked credibility; insufficient personal detail
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA Sections related to PRRA and work permit eligibility
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of danger in home country (Dominican Republic)
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible, verifiable evidence supporting risk claims
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to substantiate personal risk with credible evidence
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to PRRA assessment
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified; all submitted evidence considered but found unpersuasive
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard of reasonableness for factual findings
Crimes.Application_Factor: History of non-compliance, criminality, and late claim submission
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of procedural fairness or legal error
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness, correctness if procedural fairness involved
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: PRRA process under IRPA and IRPR
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of sufficient evidence and credibility issues in risk claim
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA Section 115–128; IRPR sections on PRRA
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide independent, reliable evidence of threat
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No breach found in procedural fairness
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of PRRA officer’s assessment
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Fair opportunity to present case – found satisfied
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose timely or corroborated evidence

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of PRRA denial based on criminal history and risk claims
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: IRPA Section 115–128 (PRRA), Controlled Drugs and Substances Act
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Whether applicant was given fair opportunity to respond to allegations
Crimes.Evidence_Disclosure_Status: All relevant evidence considered by PRRA officer
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Authority_Responsible: PRRA Officer, Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA provisions on risk assessment and criminal inadmissibility
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Past cooperation with U.S. authorities and potential retaliation
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: Reliability of single letter from applicant’s mother
Crimes.Procedural_Requirement: Right to fair and impartial assessment under administrative law
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Claimed risk linked to past cooperation with foreign law enforcement
Crimes.Evidence_Source: Applicant’s affidavit, letter from mother, criminal record
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Insufficient evidence of personal risk despite criminal history
Crimes.Charter_Issues: Section 7 (right to life, liberty, security) invoked but not violated
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Anecdotal (family letter), self-declarations, criminal history records
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims not sufficiently supported; delay in applying undermined credibility
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issues: None found – process met fairness standards
Crimes.Basis_for_Inadmissibility: Conviction for conspiracy to distribute cocaine
Crimes.Risk_Assessment_Factors: Potential gang retaliation due to past informant role
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and completeness of evidence submission
Crimes.Review_Type: Statutory judicial review of PRRA decision
Crimes.Credibility_Findings: Applicant’s account lacked corroboration and consistency
Crimes.Risk_Persecution: Claimed risk of harm from criminal organizations
Crimes.Applicant_Status: Foreign national with criminal conviction in Canada/US context
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was there an error in assessing danger upon return?
Crimes.Charter_Section_Involved: Section 7 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Relevant_Factors_Considered: Criminal history, timing of claim, credibility, country conditions
